thread.title: Gov. Baker’s economical development panel is very white and very male - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Gov. Baker’s economical development panel is very white and very male - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Gov. Baker’s economical development panel is very white and very male - Massachusetts news
text:
Governor Baker espoused diversity and inclusion in his 2014 campaign, but his economic development panel is over 80 percent male and 85 percent white, The Boston Globe reports.
Related Links Should the lottery run a DraftKings competitor? Carly Fiorina says she would consider Charlie Baker for presidential post Get today’s headlines right in your inbox The 59-person panel is charged with plotting the Bay State’s economic future, the Globe reports. Over 70 percent of people in Massachusetts entering the workforce are women of color, and Latino and Asian populations are increasing.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below “I think the council is a great idea and has many great leaders on it, but this is a missed opportunity to use government’s role to lead by example,” U.S. Representative Katherine Clark told the Globe .
Baker aides pointed out that the panel is more diverse under the current administration than the state’s first African-American governor Deval Patrick. But according to the Globe , even members of the panel have noticed a lack of diversity.
Read the full story at the Globe .
